note: especially chapter 10. On frontality, see Frontisi-Ducroux (1989).
title: The two major works on Near-Eastern influences upon Greek culture are Burkert (1992) and West
Mesopotamian antecedents of the story of Athena’s birth are explored in Penglase

note: and from a gendered perspective, Arthur
title: Athena’s connection with Zeus is examined in Sydinou (1986) and Neils (2001b). The succession myth, especially the Hesiodic version, has been the subject of extensive discussion
The major study of Athena cults across the Greek world is Villing (1998a). Athena’s cult at Sparta is discussed in Villing
The ‘mystery’ of the bells is the topic of Villing
On Argos and Kallimachos’ Bath of Pallas, see most recently Morrison
